Title: Wait List Policy
Body:
Wait List Policy

Many professional courses have enrollment maximums because of limited classroom space or due to instructor request. If you have tried to enroll once a maximum enrollment is reached, you will be asked if you would like to be placed on a waiting list. You will be automatically notified if and when space becomes available in the class.

Students on a waiting list for a professional course are NOT to attend class without receiving notice from Student Services Office that space has become available.

Open University Courses

Wait lists are available only to students enrolled in degree programs at UCSB, and wait lists are not available to Open University students.

Title: What is the difference between the 4th edition and 5th edition?
Body:
What is the difference between the 4th edition and 5th edition?

 

The 5th edition task list opens up the program to students with a Master's degree in any field/discipline. Under the 5th edition, students will need to complete 315 coursework hours and accrue 2000 fieldwork hours. The 5th edition exam will be available as of January 2022. Under the 4th edition task list only students with a Master's degree in Education, Psychology, or Behavior Analysis is eligible to take the exam. Students are expected to complete 270 coursework hours and accrue 1500 fieldwork hours. Students MUST take the 4th edition exam prior to December 31, 2021

We are no longer accepting applications for the 4th edition. Students are encouraged to apply for the 5th edition program.

For more information, visit BACB.

Title: Can I Use My G.I. Bill?
Body:
Can I Use My G.I. Bill?

No, you cannot use your G.I. Bill for enrollment in courses through the Division of Professional and Continuing Education. The division does not certify enrollment for student veteran benefits for veterans or dependents of veterans. The Open University Program is also not approved for veteran benefits.

Title: Applied Behavior Analysis Certificate Program
Body:
Applied Behavior Analysis Certificate Program

Dear,

Thank you for your interest in the Applied Behavior Analysis Certificate Program and individual courses. We received your information request and want to let you know complete information about the program and a course matrix is available at:
Applied Behavior Analysis Professional Certificate Program
Remember that UCSB Extension courses may be taken individually and, in most cases, you don't have to commit to an entire certificate program in order to take our courses.
In any given quarter you can also search on that quarter's courses by subject area. Just click on the catalog cover icon on our home page to reach that search menu.
https://enroll.professional.ucsb.edu//
This program is approved by the Behavior Analyst Certification Board and includes courses required for certification as a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA).
All inquiries are submitted to our Program Director for developing a knowledge bank about the kinds of questions participants have about the program.

Thanks again for your note of interest. Let us know if you have any additional questions by responding to this email.

Best Regards,

Title: Why does VMock display a conversion error message after uploading my PDF?
Body:
Why does VMock display a conversion error message after uploading my PDF?

Occasionally, you may receive an error message in VMock after uploading a PDF that was not converted using the proper software or export method. In most cases, this error message does not impact your resume score or feedback in VMock, but we recommend addressing the issue when possible. Microsoft Word and Google Docs are the recommended software to create resumes that comply with Applicant Tracking Systems, which includes VMock and most employer recruiting platforms. For additional details, see our FAQ on converting your PDF properly.

Title: Do You Accept Financial Assistance?
Body:
Do You Accept Financial Assistance?

Yes, UCSB Professional and Continuing Education does accept financial assistance. Please visit our page about Financial Assistance page for additional information or our Help Center articles.

Title: Is Open University for me?
Body:
Is Open University for me?

If you want to expand your knowledge and expertise in an area of your interest, advance your career, complete a certificate program, or learn at a world-class research university while earning credits, then Open University is for you! 

Community Members: Do you want to take a course at UCSB? For fun, or for study? If you live in the area, you have access to the #5 ranked public institute in the country! Further your education, learn something new, be on campus, and enjoy all that UCSB has to offer as a state of the art research institute.

Career Professionals: Need more coursework for a degree? Want to get transfer units before getting your advanced degree? Save money and take classes with world-renowned faculty! You can specialize further in a subject you know, or open a new career in pursuing a different area of study!

We'll see you soon!

Title: What is the Cost for the Young Scholars Program?
Body:
What is the Cost for the Young Scholars Program?

Please see Open University Calendar, Fees, and Major Deadlines for current fees.

Title: How is the course taught?
Body:
How is the course taught?

Lectures will take place online on weekday evenings (6:30pm-9:30pm) while skills instruction will be practiced on select Saturday (and Sunday for Summer intensive, 8:30am-5:30pm) classes.

In addition, 24 course hours will consist of off-site clinical observations in ambulances (AMR) and Hospital settings.

Title: I Have Enrolled in a Course, but Have Not Received Confirmation. What Should I Do?
Body:
I Have Enrolled in a Course, but Have Not Received Confirmation. What Should I Do?

A confirmation of enrollment will be e-mailed to you, provided that you gave your correct e-mail address at registration. Confirmations are not sent through the mail. Student Services will contact you if there is any problem with your enrollment.

Title: What Do My Fees Cover?
Body:
What Do My Fees Cover?

UCSB Professional and Continuing Education (PaCE) is supported entirely by student fees. The income from fees received for each course must cover all direct and indirect expenses associated with that course. Your fees may be subject to change or correction in the event of a scheduling error.

Title: How long can I stay in the U.S.?
Body:
How long can I stay in the U.S.?

As long as you maintain your F-1 status, you have a 60-day grace period after your I-20 program end date. If you have any questions about this please email us at help@extension.ucsb.edu as soon as possible to discuss options.

Title: I am a University Immersion Program student. Should I enroll in UCSB Extension courses in case there is no space available in my desired UCSB Academic courses?
Body:
I am a University Immersion Program student. Should I enroll in UCSB Extension courses in case there is no space available in my desired UCSB Academic courses?

The decision to enroll in UCSB professional courses because there is no space available in your desired regular session courses is up to you. 

Note: Typically, students obtain spaces in UCSB academic courses. However, since enrollment in courses is offered on a space available basis only, students may not be able to enroll in all their first-choice courses.

Students who wish to withdraw from UCSB professional courses they are enrolled in must officially cancel (withdraw) their enrollment and are subject to a nonrefundable administration fee as well as university refund policies.

Title: Late Enrollment Procedures
Body:
Late Enrollment Procedures

You are responsible for enrolling in professional courses prior to the start date of the course. However, there are some exceptions that will be granted in rare and specific circumstances. 

Open University Courses

You are responsible for enrolling in regular session UCSB courses by the established enrollment deadline.

If you want to enroll after the deadline, submit the following to UCSB Professional and Continuing Education:

  • A completed Open University Course Petition for Late or Retroactive Enrollment
  • Required administrative fee
  • A written statement explaining the circumstances causing you to miss the deadline

Exceptions to the published enrollment deadline will be granted only in very unusual and compelling circumstances. The permission to enroll after the deadline can only be granted by UCSB Professional and Continuing Education.

Title: Certificate Eligibility and Requirements - Digital Marketing
Body:
Certificate Eligibility and Requirements - Digital Marketing

A UCSB PaCE professional certificate is awarded upon completion of the 4-5 required courses totaling 14 units (or 126 hours of instruction), listed in the Program Schedule each with a letter grade of "C" / "Pass" or better. All requirements must be completed within five (5) years after the student enrolls in their first course. Students not pursuing a certificate are welcome to take as many individual courses as they wish.

There are no prerequisites for courses in this certificate nor is a bachelor's degree required.

To become an official candidate in the program, students need only register in one of the courses in the approved curriculum.

Request for Certificate Release

Application Fee $95.00

If all the Certificate requirements have been met, after your request is processed, you will receive an email notification from Parchment with a digital copy of your Certificate. A printed copy will be mailed via regular US Postal Service to the mailing address provided in your PaCE Student Profile 8-10 business days after receipt of the digital copy.

The $95 Certificate Release Fee is non-refundable. This Fee is required in order to receive a copy of your Certificate.

Click here to request your Certificate Release.

AMA & DMI Certification Information:

Upon successful completion MGMNT X477 and MGMNT X477.1, students are eligible to sit for a 3-hour computer-based examination of their digital marketing acumen.  Successful candidates will be awarded globally recognized professional certifications from the American Marketing Association (Professional Certified Marketer - PCM) and the Digital Marketing Institute (Certified Digital Marketing Professional) and a professional badge which can be displayed on their LinkedIn and social media profiles.

Title: How do I register for a certificate program?
Body:
How do I register for a certificate program?

Register for your certificate program online on the UCSD OSHA Site on the individual certificate program page, or choose one of the following options:

Phone: (800) 358-9206 - Press Option 1

Fax: (858) 246-1031

Mail your enrollment and payment to:

OSHA Training Institute Education Center

6256 Greenwich Dr.

San Diego, CA 92122

Title: How do I apply to International Programs at UCSB?
Body:
How do I apply to International Programs at UCSB?

Step 1. Apply and Enroll in International Student Programs

Complete and submit your online application International Programs:
University Immersion Program
International Diploma Program

You will need to include the following:

  • Copy of Bio page of Passport
  • Most recent transcript
  • Proof of English proficiency
  • Proof of funding
  • Application Fee (one-time, nonrefundable)

Step 2. After Acceptance to the International Student Program, Enroll in Individual Courses

You will need to submit each quarter/term course Fees (at time of course enrollment) and any additional fees as needed.

NOTE:

  • Students with TOEFL iBT scores below 20, or IELTS scores below 6, in any individual skill area (reading, writing, listening, or speaking) must successfully complete an advanced English course at UCSB Professional and Continuing Education in the respective sub-score skill area. A grade of "C" or better is required in each of these courses during the first quarter of study at UCSB International Programs.
  • All program and course deadlines must be met.
  • Space in programs and courses is not guaranteed.
  • The University Immersion Program regularly fills three months in advance of the program start date.
  • UCSB is on a quarter system: fall, winter, spring, and summer (each quarter is a period of three months).

Title: Quarterly Email - Certificate of Participation
Body:
Quarterly Email - Certificate of Participation

Dear ISP Student,

The official end date of the Winter 2017 quarter is on March 24, 2017. For every quarter that you study at UCSB Professional and Continuing Education (PaCE) you will be issued a small (5 inch X 7 inch) Certificate of Participation for the program in which you are enrolled in a minimum of 6 units. The certificate contains your name and the name and dates of your study program. Your Certificate(s) of Participation are now available for you to pick up in the Student Services Office of UCSB PaCE in Room 2166 Kerr Hall.

We'll be happy to hold on to your Certificate of Participation if you plan to continue your studies at UCSB PaCE in Spring 2017. However, you are welcome to pick up your certificate at the end of each quarter of study.

Please stop by our Student Services front desk and ask for your certificate anytime during our regular business hours Monday through Friday between the hours of 9:00 a.m. - Noon and 1:00 p.m. - 4:00 p.m.

If your final quarter of study is Winter 2017 and if you do not pick up your certificate from our office at the end of the program and before you depart the U.S. we will mail your certificate to your home country address that we have on file in your student record. It will be sent by regular air mail within 2 months following the end of your study program.

Good luck to you in completing your final exams and assignments.

Please let me know if you have any questions.

Sincerely,

Title: Open University Degrees and Degree Credit
Body:
Open University Degrees and Degree Credit

Degree Credit at UCSB - UCSB Professional and Continuing Education (PaCE) does not grant degrees, nor are degrees awarded through the Open University Program. However, UCSB academic course credits earned through UCSB Open University (XSB1 to XSB199 Undergraduate Open University courses) can be applied to degree programs at UCSB and all University of California. More information can be found here.

*UCSB students should note that courses numbered X300-399 and X400-499 are professional-level (post-baccalaureate) credit courses and lecture series in fields other than education and therefore will not apply to degree credit.

Please review the full procedure on how to enroll in Open University here.

Degree Credit at Another University - If you are seeking a degree at another university, you are urged to verify acceptability of the credit through consultation with your own university academic program advisor prior to enrollment through UCSB Open University Program.

Admission to the University of California - Participating in the Open University Program does not provide preference in admission to the University of California. If you are interested in applying to the University of California you should refer to the UC Admissions website or the admissions office of the UC campus you wish to attend for details about the admissions process.

Title: Academic Advising
Body:
Academic Advising

Formal group and individual academic advising sessions are held after the program start date and prior to the first day of instruction. If you need to schedule an individual academic advising session, this is available after instruction starts, during posted advising hours, or by appointment.

Title: What options do I have for transportation? What if I don&'t have a car?
Body:
What options do I have for transportation? What if I don&'t have a car?

There are many options outside of driving your own car to get around in the Santa Barbara area. Here are a few options:

  • Rent a Car
    • If you don't own a car, there are times when you may need one. When you rent a car, you're using a company's vehicle for a short period of time.
  • Join a Car Sharing Service
    • If you'd rather rent a car on an hourly basis and have greater flexibility in where and when you can pick up a vehicle, you can join a car sharing service like Zipcar. With car sharing, you get the convenience of a car when you need one, but without the costs of ownership.
  • Ride a Bike
    • Many students at UCSB choose to ride a bike to and from their classes. UCSB is a very bike-friendly campus with many bike paths and racks to lock your bike. Additionally, the city of Santa Barbara has protected bike lanes throughout the city and trails that can get you from campus to downtown. 
  • Take the Bus
    • The Metropolitan Transportation District (MTD) bus system allows riders to get around Isla Vista, Goleta, and the greater Santa Barbara area. You may pick up a MTD bus sticker at UCSB Professional and Continuing Education ((PaCE) Student Services using your student ID card.

Title: In what order should I take the courses after finishing the fundamental OSHA courses?
Body:
In what order should I take the courses after finishing the fundamental OSHA courses?

There is no required order to the coursework. Once you have completed the prerequisites or foundational courses you can take any course in your area of interest.

Title: UCSB Recreation Center - RecCen
Body:
UCSB Recreation Center - RecCen

Access to the RecCen is included in your program fees. The RecCen offers exercise equipment, sport facilities, and pools that you may access. When you go to the RecCen you must present your UCSB Access ID card at the entrance. No other picture ID will be accepted.

For other offers like GauchoRec and Adventure Programs, UCSB PaCE students pay the "community rate."

Title: Do I need a C in each course, ECON 1 and ECON 2 or do I just need a 2.0 gpa in these courses combined?
Body:
Do I need a C in each course, ECON 1 and ECON 2 or do I just need a 2.0 gpa in these courses combined?

Students will rely heavily on foundational knowledge gained from ECON 1 and 2 to participate and succeed in the Strategic Investments Program.  Thus, the requirement is that students must have a C (or 'Pass') grade or better in each of the pre-requisite courses.

Title: Transferring Courses toward Completion of a PCP or PSA
Body:
Transferring Courses toward Completion of a PCP or PSA

You may transfer courses toward completion of a certificate program, but only if you earned a "C" or better for the course and if it was completed within the last five years. Questions regarding eligibility for transfer should be requested through Student Services. Programs not listed do not allow for transfer of credit.

Transfer credit is limited to 4 quarter units for the following program:

  • Digital Marketing

Transfer credit is limited to 4 quarter units for the following programs:

  • Business Leadership
  • Practical Project Management

Transfer credit is limited to 8 quarter units for the following programs:

  • Business Accounting
  • Professional Accounting
  • Human Resource Management
  • Paralegal Studies

Questions concerning transferability of credit toward degree programs at other schools should be directed to the degree-granting institution.

Title: Zoom security: preventing "Zoom Bombing"
Body:
Zoom security: preventing "Zoom Bombing"

We have seen an increasing number of incidents involving third parties crashing zoom sessions and courses. To prevent that from happening, please consider spending some time fine-tuning your zoom settings, following the UCSB Instructional Development setting recommendations.

Title: University Immersion/Preparation Program Roadmap
Body:
University Immersion/Preparation Program Roadmap

After you are admitted and before the program begins, UCSB Professional and Continuing Education will e-mail you further instructions about the program. In order to prepare for your enrollment here at UCSB, read the following roadmap to learn more about the steps for program participation:

  1. Review your course options.

  2. Apply and enroll in International Student Programs.

  3. Apply for your F-1 Visa.

  4. Arrange for your housing.

  5. Submit your list of proposed courses.

  6. Clear your course prerequisites and enroll in courses.

  7. Complete the online orientation.

  8. Be there for your program start at UCSB.

  9. Attend your selected classes and enroll in courses.

  10. Join activities and get involved on campus.

We here at UCSB Professional and Continuing Education hope you enjoy your studies with us!

Title: What to Expect from the EMT Course
Body:
What to Expect from the EMT Course

1. 186 Course Hours:

  • 80 skills lab hours, in-person on campus (Weekends, 8:30am-5:30pm)
  • 66 lecture hours, mostly live (Weekday evenings, 6:30-9:30pm)
  • 24 Clinical Observation hours (Self-scheduled) on an AMR Ambulance and at one Hospital location (Santa Barbara, Goleta, or Solvang).
  • 8 hours for NR-EMT Psychomotor/Skills Exam (Last weekend of class)
  • 8 hours CPR class (One weekend, 8:30am-5:30pm)

 

 2. Additional Course Costs:

In addition to course tuition, there are other required expenses necessary to successfully complete the EMT Certification Course:

  • Textbook Emergency Care, 14th Edition $95
  • Student medical supplies - $85
  • CastleBranch Subscription - $85 (includes: Background check, Drug test, TB screening and influenza vaccine)
  • EMStesting test preparation subscription - $50
  • Physical - conducted by your GP or UCSB Health Center
  • Additional charges based on test vaccine compliance

Approximate total cost of course including tuition: $2,400

***PaCE Scholarships available! Apply Here.***

 

3. Course Requirements

To become a certified EMT the following requirements must be fulfilled during the course. Details will be shared in first day of class:

  • CPR certification (included in the program)
  • Drug Test
  • Physical Exam
  • Background Check 
  • Childhood immunization verification
  • Hepatitis, Influenza, and Covid-19 Vaccines 
  • Tuberculosis Testing

* no medical or religious exemptions accepted due to the clinical partnerships

 

4. Exams:

In addition to passing the course you will need to pass the following National Registry of EMT (NREMT) exams.

  • National Registry Practical Exam- This exam is held at UCSB the weekend after the final exam. While the practical can be taken anywhere, we HIGHLY recommend you take it at UCSB.
  • Cognitive Exam - This is a computer-based test and it is given through Pearson-Vue Testing Centers (www.vue.com) online. This exam can be taken before or after the practical exam.

Once you complete the cognitive and practical exams, you become nationally registered. This certification does NOT allow you to work as an EMT. You must become CA State licensed first.

Title: I would like to travel back to my home country, but can't find a flight. What should I do?
Body:
I would like to travel back to my home country, but can't find a flight. What should I do?

Unfortunately, flight availability is constantly changing. Students who are having trouble finding a flight home should reach out to their country's Embassy or Consulate in the U.S. Many countries are arranging special travel for international students in the U.S. trying to get home.

Title: Information on UCSB Canvas Transition and Support
Body:
Information on UCSB Canvas Transition and Support

UCSB is moving to a new Learning Management System called Canvas. The existing Gauchospace LMS will retire once Canvas is fully adopted.

In Summer 2023, all courses will be in Canvas unless a specific exemption is granted. 

For detailed information on this project, please visit this page.

During regular business hours, if you have any questions about Canvas, please contact your Program Manager or PaCE Customer Service via email at program.support@extension.ucsb.edu or via phone at 805-893-4200. Our regular business hours are Monday through Friday, from 9am to 5pm PST (we are closed on weekends and US Federal Holidays).

After business hours, if you have any technical issues with your course in Canvas, please contact Canvas Support. They provide 24/7 instructor support and can be reached via:

  • Phone at 866-325-1488
  • Chat via Canvas' Live Chat Agent
  • Create a Canvas support ticket from the Canvas Help tab

 

 

 

UCSB Guides: Specific guides for using Canvas at UCSB, UCSB Canvas Guides.

Additional Canvas Instructor resources can be found here.

Title: Nondiscrimination
Body:
Nondiscrimination

The University of California, in accordance with applicable Federal and State law and university policy, does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, sex, gender identity, pregnancy,1 disability, age, medical condition (cancer-related or genetic characteristics), ancestry, marital status, citizenship, sexual orientation, or service in the uniformed services.2 The university also prohibits sexual harassment. This nondiscrimination policy covers admission, access, and treatment in university programs and activities.

Inquiries regarding the university's student-related nondiscrimination policies may be directed to UCSB Office of Judicial Affairs.

1 Pregnancy includes pregnancy, childbirth, and medical conditions related to pregnancy or childbirth.
2 As defined by the Uniform Services Employment and Reemployment Rights Act of 1994.

Title: Certificate Eligibility and Requirements - Business Law and Communication
Body:
Certificate Eligibility and Requirements - Business Law and Communication

A certificate is awarded upon completion of the 4 required courses totaling 14  units (or 126 hours of instruction), listed in the Program Schedule each with a letter grade of "C" / "Pass" or better. All requirements must be completed within five (5) years after the student enrolls in their first course. Title: Response for: All Inquiries from Students with No TOEFL or IELTS Test Scores
Body:
Response for: All Inquiries from Students with No TOEFL or IELTS Test Scores

Whether "Study in the USA"-generated or not, in the case where you receive in-coming inquiries from students with no TOEFL or IELTS test scores, please send this message macro.  

 

No TOEFL or IELTS Score? KITE Testing

Dear [name],

Thank you for your inquiry regarding minimum entrance proficiency requirements for English Language programs at UCSB Professional and Continuing Education (PaCE).

If you are not able to provide the required TOEFL or IELTS scores, then we will ask you to take an equivalent English Language proficiency test called a KITE test.

The cost for this service is $220, and the 3 required tests (grammar/vocabulary/comprehension + writing + speaking/pronunciation) will be conducted online, with video/webcam proctoring (live observation of you). Once you pay for this test via our UCSB PaCE website, we will put you in touch with the KITE Testing company here in Santa Barbara. 

There is no guarantee of acceptance into our program simply by taking the KITE test. You must also demonstrate via the KITE test that you have met the minimum language proficiency requirement: CEFR B2 (equivalent to TOEFL iBT 60, IELTS 6.0).

Our Program Director is happy to answer any further questions you have.


[APPLY STUDY IN THE USA MACRO HERE]

Title: Why can&'t I find PaCE in Gold?
Body:
Why can't I find PaCE in Gold?

Most PACE courses offer "professional" units (X300-X400 courses) which do not use Gold for registration, enrollment or transcripts.

Title: How do I view my grades?
Body:
How do I view my grades?

Sometimes, instructors inform students of their grades by email or via Canvas. However, grades are official only after they are received by our UCSB Professional and Continuing Education (PaCE) office and recorded and approved into our enrollment system by the PaCE Registrar. Grades posted in Canvas are not official.

Final grades will be visible in your PaCE Student profile within two weeks from the end of the quarter. You can view your grades by logging into your PaCE student profile at the PaCE Student Portal.

Once logged in, click on "My Enrollment History" under the "Completed Courses" tab, you will find a list of completed classes with associated information, including grades. 

If there are courses listed as 'In Progress', then your Instructor has not submitted your final grades to us yet.

Title: What Are My Payment Options?
Body:
What Are My Payment Options?

For your convenience, the Division of Professional and Continuing Education accepts payment by credit card, check, cash (exact amounts only), and company purchase order. Students without a receipt for payment of a course or an enrollment verification form are prohibited from attending classes. The Division of Professional and Continuing Education does not accept financial aid as a form of payment.

More information on enrollment is available on our "How to Enroll" page.

Title: How has Covid-19 affected the EMT course?
Body:
How has Covid-19 affected the EMT course?

UCSB PaCE is monitoring the COVID19 Pandemic closely and working to ensure the safety of all of our students and staff. 

All EMT Certification Courses are now being conducted as blended classes with online lectures and in-person skills training/assessment in order to prepare students for full EMT certification.  

Rigorous and thorough protective measures will be taken to prevent the spread of COVID-19 and to protect the program's students, faculty, and staff. These measures will include but not limited to:

  • Abiding by the Santa Barbara County Health Officer's Order 2020-8 Social Distancing Protocol 
  • Wearing of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) at all times
  • Recording student temperatures at all in-person class sessions
  • A COVID-19 Screening Survey has to be submitted before each in-person class

Title: Creating an online course in Gauchospace
Body:
Creating an online course in Gauchospace

You can use Gauchospace as a repository of lecture materials, quizzes and exams, embed videos, presentations, and other materials you currently use in your face to face lectures.  Panopto will allow you to record and broadcast video later using Gauchocast.  Through Zoom, you can offer your lectures online from home.

If you would like to record and put select lectures online and make them available asynchronously, please let us know.

We will be holding periodical Zoom calls to make sure that you all are comfortable with the tools you need to use, and also help you run the pilots.  Kindly attend one of those sessions, even if you are familiar with the system, as we all can benefit from your experience. 

 

NOTE: You do not need to request zoom, just go to ucsb.zoom.us and log in with your UCSBNetID and Password

If you still need to activate your UCSBNet ID, Activate your UCSBNet ID

If you do not remember your UCSBNet ID password, How to reset your UCSBNet ID password

Official ZOOM training tutorials:
https://learning.zoom.us/learn/public/catalog/view/9

ZOOM for Education

https://learning.zoom.us/learn/public/catalog/view/56 

Exams
You have the option to substitute formal exams and quizzes with class projects.  If you typically use multiple-choice style exams and need an online alternative, the best solution will be to use the Quiz Tool in GauchoSpace to build an alternate exam. The Quiz Tool allows you to build an exam from a reusable question pool. In addition, the exams allow for randomizing the order that questions are presented, randomizing the order in which responses are presented for each question, locking down the browser window during the quiz, and randomizing what questions each student gets on their exam from a larger pool (equivalent to preparing multiple versions of the same exam).

Resources to help you get started using quizzes in GauchoSpace:

  • Best Practices for Setting Up Quizzes in GauchoSpace
  • Creating Multiple Choice Quiz Questions in Gauchospace using Word.
  • Reference Guide to Setting up Quizzes

No proctoring option is available to UCSB PaCE at this time.

Title: Why do I need to enroll through UC San Diego Extension?
Body:
Why do I need to enroll through UC San Diego Extension?

(UCSB Professional and Continuing Education (PaCE)  is the partner training site for OSHA Training Institute Education Centers (OTIECs) of  UC San Diego Extension.  Although the classes are conducted at UCSB, the student registration is handled by UCSD Extension. Therefore all students need to enroll through UCSD Extension.

Title: Parking
Body:
Parking

Parking permits are required to park on the UCSB campus. Weekday visitors will need to buy a regular campus permit from 7:30 a.m.-5 p.m., Monday through Friday. There are also parking fees in effect for weeknights after 5 p.m. and all day on weekends. Individual daily and weekend permits may be purchased from permit dispensers located throughout the campus parking lots. You may purchase a monthly, evening, and weekend-pass from the permit dispensers or the Transportation & Parking Services office.

Parking rates and regulations are subject to change. Please check the Transportation & Parking Services website or call (805) 893-7275 for detailed information on current permit rates, requirements, and parking regulations. Parking infractions are subject to citation.

Title: How do I transfer my I-20 to another school?
Body:
How do I transfer my I-20 to another school?

To transfer to another school or program in the U.S., you must:

  1. Apply for acceptance at the school you wish to be transferred to.
  2. Complete the Change Form and send an email to the UCSB International Program's Immigration Advisor attaching the new school's Transfer In Form (if applicable) and your Acceptance Letter from your new university/ school.
  3. After the Immigration Advisor receives confirmation of your acceptance, your I-20 will be scheduled in the SEVIS database to be released to the new school on your last day of the program or after. This will enable the new school to issue a revised I-20 for their program while still keeping the same I-20 number.


The transfer process must be completed within the 60-day grace period immediately following the UCSB PaCE program completion date. You must begin studying at your new school during the next available quarter, which can be no later than five months from the program end date at UCSB PaCE.

If you plan to leave the U.S. between programs, you must be accepted by and receive an I-20 from the new school before re-entering the U.S. It is essential that a transfer student re-enter the U.S. with the new school's I-20 form. You must inform the UCSB Immigration Advisor of the date you are leaving the US before the quarter ends, by completing the form ucsb.pro/changeform. 

If you leave the U.S. between programs and the visa in your passport has expired, the new I-20 form must be taken‚Äîalong with other required documents‚Äîto a U.S. embassy or consulate to get a new visa. If the visa has NOT expired, you do not need to apply for a new visa. We recommend that you keep all former schools' I-20s in your luggage in case the immigration officer at the port of entry asks to see them.

Title: Tips for Living in the United States
Body:
Tips for Living in the United States

Use the Language
You came here to improve your English, so make every effort to use it daily. Not only should you try to speak English, but you should try to read American newspapers and magazines, listen to the radio, and watch television. These things will not only improve your English, but they will also teach you about American culture. It is also a very good idea to agree to speak English with other students from your own country! Americans enjoy talking with international students, but you may have to start the conversation. Ask them questions about the U.S. to show you are interested in learning more about our culture.

Be Honest
If you do not understand something, admit it. It's usually best to tell someone you don't understand something rather than trying to pretend that everything is alright.

Learn to Laugh at Yourself
Communicating in a foreign language is difficult, and you may get nervous about making mistakes at first.

Laughing at your own mistakes and taking risks are positive ways of dealing with the adjustment process.

Get Involved in Activities
You must take the first step in making friends and participating in activities. To get to know your classmates, ask them about their cultures and their experiences. Keeping busy with them and attending activities is a good way to avoid homesickness.

Put Yourself in Other People's Shoes
Try to look at situations from the perspective of other people. Always ask questions and explain what you are thinking. What may seem obvious or reasonable to you may not be for someone else because of cultural differences.

Avoid Stereotyping and Making Snap Judgments
It's natural to judge everything you observe and experience here as "good" or "bad." However, this can block you from understanding American culture. Try not to judge people and situations until you feel you understand why they are acting a certain way. And remember, most things are not really "better" or "worse" than they are in your country. They are just different!

Title: Who Does NOT Qualify for GROW Financial Aid?
Body:
Who Does NOT Qualify for GROW Financial Aid?

  • Anyone not residing in North Santa Barbara County, San Luis Obispo County or Kern County
  • Registered UCSB students and UCSB Faculty and Staff
  • Visiting international students (part of UCSB's International Programs)
  • Students taking courses NOT LISTED in the eligible programs on the GROW webpage.

Title: I Forgot my UCSBnetID Password
Body:
I Forgot my UCSBnetID Password

Please follow below instructions to reset your password associated with your UCSBnetID.

  • Sign in to the Identity Manager and click on the "Professional and Continuing Education" link.
  • Type in your Last Name, your Date of Birth and your UCSB PaCE Student Account ID (this begins with a capital letter X). Click "Next".
  • Click the "Reset UCSBnetID Password" button.  You will be asked to verify your identity by entering the answers to two of the security questions you chose during the creation of your UCSBnetID. After answering your security questions click "Next" and follow directions to reset your password.

Contact UCSB's Identity Services if you don't remember the answers to your security questions.  You can reach their student helpdesk by submitting a ticket here or by phone at 805-893-4357.

They are open weekdays between 8 am and 5 pm PST. Responses are generally no later than the end of the next business day, volume permitting.

Title: Certificate Eligibility and Requirements
Body:
Certificate Eligibility and Requirements

A certificate is awarded upon completion of the 5 required courses totaling 16 units (or 144 hours of instruction), listed in the Program Schedule each with a letter grade of "C" / "Pass" or better. All requirements must be completed within five (5) years after the student enrolls in their first course. Students not pursuing a certificate are welcome to take as many individual courses as they wish.

There are no prerequisites for courses in this certificate nor is a bachelor's degree required.

To become an official candidate in the program, students need only register in one of the courses in the approved curriculum.

Request for Certificate Release

Application Fee $45.00

If all the Certificate requirements have been met, after your request is processed, you will receive an email notification from Parchment with a digital copy of your Certificate. A printed copy will be mailed via regular US Postal Service to the mailing address provided in your PaCE Student Profile 8-10 business days after receipt of the digital copy.

The $45 Certificate Release Fee is non-refundable. This Fee is required in order to receive a copy of your Certificate.

Click here to request your Certificate Release.

Title: How do I enroll and pay for a Strategic Investments course?
Body:
How do I enroll and pay for a Strategic Investments course?

SIP courses are only open to students that have been admitted to the program.  To apply, please complete the Strategic Investments Application.  Applicants will receive a notification once we have verified completion of the prerequisite courses (ECON 1, ECON 2, and ECON 3A).  This process may take up to 2 business days.

Once admitted to the program, students can enroll by clicking on the course link, adding it to the shopping cart, and checking out with a payment. To determine if you meet the prerequisites for a particular course, check the online description by clicking on the course link.

Title: Eligibility and Requirements - Blockchain Technologies
Body:
Eligibility and Requirements - Blockchain Technologies

Take an individual course, or earn a certificate!

Individual blockchain courses from the following areas can be taken at any time, on a course-by-course basis:

-Core
-Developer 
-Professional

To qualify for a certificate, you must enroll in one of the following full Certificate Programs:

Certified Blockchain Developer

Certified Blockchain Project Manager

Certified Blockchain Business Professional

Certified Blockchain Finance Professional

Certified Blockchain Insurance Professional

Certified Blockchain Healthcare Professional

Certified Blockchain Accounting Professional

Certified Blockchain Supply Chain Professional

Certified Blockchain Legal Professional


Enrollment to Completion - How much time do I have to complete the course?
The courses are designed to help you achieve a Certificate of Completion within 6 months. Learners eager to complete the program quickly can accomplish a Certificate within 6 weeks. Your blockchain courses provide a lot of flexibility allowing you to take the self-paced portion of your program at your convenience and pace. LIVE Virtual Training portions of your course are held regulatory (roughly every six weeks). For LIVE instruction you select a seat in an upcoming LIVE delivery. If you have not selected a seat the system will prompt you weekly to 'Select a seat'. You may change your LIVE instruction dates should you have scheduling conflicts or do not yet feel you've completed enough of the self-paced content to sit for the more engaging LIVE instruction.

Upon completion of a Certificate program, you will be able to claim your digital certificate from our Customer Services Office within 30 days of completion. You will be notified by email when it is ready.

 

You will be held to the certificate requirements in place at the time you pay your certificate fee. If the requirements for your certificate change, you can choose to complete the certificate under the new requirements. Because program requirements are usually updated to accommodate changing demands in a career field, you generally will not be allowed elect to complete the certificate under requirements that were discontinued prior to your registration in the program. Contact your program representative for more information.

Title: Read me first in advance of the first day of class
Body:
Read me first in advance of the first day of class

Here is some essential instructor information: 

A Lectern Login is needed to access the lectern computer in our classrooms. This is not to be confused with your UCSBNet ID (see below). Your Lectern User ID is either in the format first name.last name (i.e., john.smith) or initial of your first name and last name (i.e., jsmith). If you do not remember your User ID, please email help@professional.ucsb.edu. If you do not remember your password, you will need to reset it in person by visiting the Instructional Development office in Kerr Hall 1160 (open weekdays 8 AM - 5 PM). Note that this password cannot be reset remotely. 

UCSBNet ID: is required to access wireless internet in the classroom and other essential services (i.e. UCPath). If you don't have a UCSBNetID, please follow these instructions. If you already have a UCSBBNetID and don't remember your password, follow these steps to reset it.

Kerr Hall Classroom Support: if you need a quick refresh on using the lectern, please email Program Support at help@professional.ucsb.edu before your first day of class so we can assist you.

Class Rosters: Instructors are responsible for viewing/printing their own class roster.  This roster can be found in the Instructor Portal. You will have access to your class list starting 21 days prior to the start date. If a student attends your course and does NOT appear on your class list, please email the student's name along with your course name to program.support@extension.ucsb.edu 

Photocopying: we strongly discourage photocopying, and prefer that Canvas, our online Learning Management System, be used for class assignments and other documents.  If you need to photocopy tests and quizzes, or the syllabus for the first day of the class you are welcome to stop by to use our facility and use our copy machine. Unfortunately, we will NOT be able to provide photocopying services. 

Course Evaluations Starting F19, we will be mimicking UCSB's evaluation procedure.  Evaluations will be sent electronically to all PaCE students during one of the last classes of your course. Results will be shared about a month later. An email notification will be sent out to all Instructors once the Evaluations are available for review.

Contact Information: you have received an email with contact information to use in case of an emergency, (for example, a building is locked or a student worker did not show up for your class when you need help). Please keep that communication for your records, or email help@professional.ucsb.edu to be reminded. 

Door  Keys: We will open doors to Kerr Hall and classrooms prior to your class.   If you are the last instructor to leave, please shut the door to hallway as you leave.  As an FYI: We have two portable lockboxes that contain two spare keys to the Kerr Hall classrooms.  These are located in the hallway on the outside lobby door and the outside door to 2140.  

Each key will open the 2166 lobby, 2166A, 2166B and 2140 classroom doors and has a label with contact information and instruction to return key to lock box when done. If you don&'t remember the code, email help@professional.ucsb.edu to be reminded. 

Additional Resources:

UCSB Map - http://www.aw.id.ucsb.edu/maps/ucsbmap.html

UCSB Parking - Permit information can be found here. Click here for parking rates.

Program Support - Program Support can assist you with classroom issues including media and access during business hours. They can be reached at (805) 893-4200 or via our contact form.

Our office is open Monday through Friday, 9am to 5pm PST. Program Support is not available after business hours.

Title: How to Drop or Withdraw from My Professional Course
Body:
How to Drop or Withdraw from My Professional Course

Dropping and Withdrawing from Courses

You can request to drop from a course before the deadline (ALWAYS check the course page for specific drop policy stipulations and published deadlines). After the deadline, you can only ask for a withdrawal.

The instructions below refer only to Professional Courses (X1 - X899). If you are taking a UCSB Course (XSBxxxx) through Open University click here for drop policies and instructions.

You have two easy options to request a drop from your course(s):

1) Submit a written drop request using our help request form.

2) Log in to your Student Portal, then: Navigate to "My Enrollment History (Current Courses) " and select the course you would like to drop. On the right side, under "Actions and Status," select "Request Drop". 

You will receive an e-mail confirmation within 1-2 business days after your drop request is processed.

Exceptions:
All requests for exceptions must be submitted in writing by using our help request form. Be sure to attach any supporting documents (such as a doctor's note).

Refund Deadline:
A minimum $40 non-refundable administrative fee per course is charged for ALL refunds except when courses are cancelled, discontinued, or rescheduled. Please note that some individual courses or programs may have additional refund policies which can be found on the corresponding course and/or program webpage and/or below. 

Programs with Specific Drop Policy Stipulations

  • For EMT Course Drop and Withdrawal Policy, please review this article.
  • For CPA Licensure Prep Summer Program Drop and Withdrawal Policy, please review this article.
  • For Strategic Investments Drop and Withdrawal Policy, please review this article.

Professional Courses with 1-6 Meetings

  • A full refund is given (less the $40 non-refundable administrative fee per course) if notice is received 5 days or more before the start date of the course. A 50% refund is given (less the $40 non-refundable administrative fee per course) if notice is received 1-4 days before the start date of the course. No refunds are given after the course begins.

Professional Courses with 7 or More Meetings and Online

  • A full refund is given (less the $40 non-refundable administrative fee per course) if notice is received by 11:59 pm on the second Sunday from the course start date. No refunds are given if notice is received after the refund deadlines.
  • Fees paid by check are refunded with a check. Allow 4-8 weeks from the date the refund is requested to receive the check. Fees paid using VISA, MasterCard, or Discover will be credited back to that card within 5-7 business days once a drop request is received. Please check with your credit card company for information on their credit policy terms.

Withdrawal policies vary depending on the course level. Click the appropriate link below to find the policy related to the course you are enrolled.

Withdrawals for Professional Courses X1 - X199
Withdrawals for Professional Courses X300 - X499
Withdrawals for Professional Courses X800 - X899

Title: What is Open University?
Body:
What is Open University?

The UCSB Open University Program is a cooperative arrangement between the UCSB campus and UCSB Professional and Continuing Education (PaCE) that enables qualified individuals to enroll in undergraduate and graduate courses on a space-available basis without being formally admitted to UCSB.

Open University is ideal for those who are:

  • Returning to school
  • Preparing to enter UCSB
  • Seeking to complete a few units to graduate
  • Desiring to take specific UCSB courses for professional reasons.

If you meet all prerequisites, there is space in a class, and the instructor approves of your participation, you may enroll in UCSB main-campus courses. Seats are not guaranteed in any class because matriculated students (those who are enrolled in a degree program at UCSB) have priority enrollment.

Credits earned through Open University may be applied to degree programs at UCSB, provided all policies and procedures (including petitions) are adhered to as stated in the UCSB General Catalog and the UCSB Schedule of Classes.

If you are seeking a degree at another university, you are urged to verify acceptability of Open University credit through consultation with your own university academic advisor prior to enrollment through UCSB Professional and Continuing Education.

Please note that participation in Open University does not constitute admission to UCSB. Course credits are recorded through UCSB Professional and Continuing Education.

Title: Immunization Recommendations
Body:
Immunization Recommendations

All students enrolled in degree programs at the University of California (UC) campuses are required to provide information about their risk for tuberculosis (TB) and their completion of certain vaccines before they can attend classes. 

Although you will not be enrolled in a degree program, we strongly urge you to get all of the immunizations before your arrival (if your program lasts for two or more months). For more detailed information, please read the University of California Immunization Recommendations.

If you are at a higher risk for TB infection, you should undergo either skin or blood testing for TB infection before your arrival and should have been tested within the past 12 months.

Higher risk includes extended travel to, or born in the following countries: South and Central America, Africa, China, Asia, Eastern Europe, and the Middle East; OR a prior positive TB test; OR current or planned immunosuppression; OR work or volunteering in healthcare or correctional facilities; OR exposure to someone with active TB disease.

The following list of immunizations are not required for admission or registration at UCSB Professional and Continuing Education, but we strongly recommend that you check your records to be sure that you have had each of the following vaccine:

  • Tdap (tetanus, diphtheria, pertussis) - a "booster" vaccine every 10 years for adults
  • MMR (measles, mumps, rubella) - two doses
  • Varicella (chicken pox) - two doses
  • Meningococcal Conjugate (MCV4) - one dose after age 16 years old

Getting immunizations in your country before you arrive is best, but you may arrange a medical appointment for immunizations and a TB screening after your arrival in Santa Barbara if you are unable to complete the recommended tasks prior to your departure. Your medical insurance through UCSB Professional and Continuing Education will cover the cost of select immunizations and a TB screening.

Your vaccine dates and TB screening information can be submitted to UCSB through the confidential Student Health "Gateway" e-mail system using your UCSB Net ID on the Student Health website.  

UCSB also strongly recommends the following immunizations:

  • Hepatitis A vaccine
  • Hepatitis B vaccine
  • Human papilloma virus (HPV) vaccine
  • Influenza vaccine
  • Poliovirus vaccine (Polio)
  • Meningococcal serogroup B vaccine

For any questions about vaccines and recommended immunizations, please contact UCSB Student Health by e-mail at shsentranceimmunizations@sa.ucsb.edu.

Title: Payment Options for your Agency
Body:
Payment Options for your Agency

1. Before a quarter's start date (Application, Program, and Student Services fees only)

Please see the payment options below. Credit card information could be provided as part of online application. Please note that credit card information is deleted after processing the Application, Student Services, and Program Fees. Course fees are to be paid separately via invoicing.

2. Via invoicing

Representatives may choose to be invoiced for Program, Student Services, and Course Fees. In this case UCSB Professional and Continuing Education will invoice Representatives for Program and Course fees quarterly after each quarter's drop deadline. If paying by credit card, upon receipt of the invoice, please call our student services line (805) 893-4200. We can no longer store credit cards information due to credit card compliance rules. All payments of invoices by credit card have to be done over the phone or in person.

PAYMENT OPTIONS:

Checks, Money Orders, Credit Cards, Wire Transfers

All payments must be made in U.S. dollars and payable to UC Regents. Acceptable are:

  • Credit cards (Visa and MasterCard only)
  • International postal money orders, drawn on U.S. Bank in U.S. Dollars
  • Company checks drawn on U.S. bank (Checks must have current information encoded on checks)

    If paying by check, it should be payable to 'UC Regents' and mailed to:

    UCSB PaCE
    University of California , Santa Barbara
    2160 Kerr Hall - MC 1110
    Santa Barbara, CA 93106-1110

  • International wire transfer (Requires additional $35.00 wire payment fee)

    If paying by wire transfer, please transfer funds directly to:

    Bank of America, New York
    100 W 33rd St, 4th Fl
    New York NY 10001
    Routing: 026009593
    Account #: 0780500030
    Swift Code: BOFAUS3N

Title: Study in the USA Response for: Bridge Programs
Body:
Study in the USA Response for: Bridge Programs

Use the text below at the start of any response to inquiries about the Bridge Programs "field of interest" that come from the "Study in the USA" website.

Bridge Programs


Dear [name],

Thank you for your interest in Bridge Programs at UC Santa Barbara Extension.

We offer two different English language and academic preparation bridge programs for students who plan to apply for admission to an American University:

  1. If you plan to apply for Graduate School, the our Graduate Studies Preparation Program may be ideal for you. The minimum entrance fluency score is: TOEFL iBT 80, IELTS 6.5, or CEFR C1.

  2. If you plan to apply for Undergraduate study in the USA, then our intensive TOEFL Preparation and Advanced English Program courses will give you the knowledge and practice for increasing your scores to the required university entrance level. Within two quarters, 90% of our students reach a TOEFL iBT score of 80, which is suitable for undergraduate entry into most departments at UC Santa Barbara. The minimum entrance fluency score is: TOEFL iBT 60, IELTS 6.0, or CEFR B2.

 

Other information:

  • Program Options, Fees and Dates
  • To apply, go to the International Student Program page and click on the blue "Apply Now" tab
  • The application is a two-step process:
  1. You must apply and enroll in the International Student Program.
  2. After acceptance into the International Student Program, you then enroll in individual courses.

 

[APPLY STUDY IN THE USA MACRO HERE]

Title: Student Conduct
Body:
Student Conduct

UCSB Professional and Continuing Education affirms an instructor's right to teach in a controlled, positive learning environment. Our policy on student conduct upholds that right and also ensures due process for students. UCSB PaCE students are expected to demonstrate a commitment to academic integrity and to civic responsibility. As a UCSB PaCE student, you are subject to disciplinary action for several types of misconduct, such as cheating on exams, forgery, theft, destruction of property, disruption of classes, physical or verbal abuse of others, sexual harassment, and possession of alcohol, drugs, or firearms. Actions may include, but are not limited to, dismissal and denial of enrollment in future professional and continuing education classes. For more information, contact Student Services at (805) 893-4200.

Title: VMock: Why did my resume receive a low score / How can I improve my score?
Body:
VMock: Why did my resume receive a low score / How can I improve my score?

Similar to real-life career applications, there are hundreds of different factors that influence the score your resume receives in VMock, including the Resume Benchmark you selected for your career interests, current methods for how recruiters review resumes, and critical checkpoints to optimize your resume for Applicant Tracking Systems.

Title: Will the units count towards my total unit requirement for my UCSB degree?
Body:
Will the units count towards my total unit requirement for my UCSB degree?

At this time, the professional units completed through PaCE do not count toward UCSB's unit requirements for academic degree programs. 

Furthermore, current UCSB matriculated students, who are eligible for financial aid, may be required to maintain a minimum of 12 academic units of undergraduate or graduate level courses. The ECON X professional units do not count toward that minimum.

Title: How Early Can I Enroll in a Course?
Body:
How Early Can I Enroll in a Course?

Early enrollment is available, but when you can enroll will vary depending on the course and instructor. If a course is not yet available for enrollment, you may still search for the course to read the description and pre-requisite information. To search for courses that are not yet available for enrollment, scroll down to the bottom of the Course Search page and select "Search all courses" under "Filter by Course Availability." For courses that are not currently offered, you have the option to click on the"Request Information" button at the course level, which allows you to set up an alert to be notified when the course opens for enrollment.

Title: Why can&'t I find INT X410 or INT X411 in Gold?
Body:
Why can&'t I find INT X410 or INT X411 in Gold?

The INT X410 units are "professional" units (X400s) offered through PaCE which does not use Gold for registration, enrollment or transcripts.

Title: Empowerment and Opportunity Fund Professional Scholarships FAQs
Body:
Empowerment and Opportunity Fund Professional Scholarships FAQs

Who?

Our Empowerment and Opportunity Fund Professional scholarships are reserved to residents of Santa Barbara, San Luis Obispo, Ventura and Kern counties only.

Applications are judged holistically and not solely on the basis of financial need, and they are awarded at PaCE management discretion, and are limited by funds availability.

These programs are NOT eligible for Empowerment and Opportunity Fund Professional Scholarships:

  • CPA Licensure Prep Summer Program
  • Blockchain Academy
  • Emergency Medical Technician (EMT)
  • Environmental and Climate Advocacy (ECALA)
  • Intersectional Justice Facilitator (IJF)
  • Quickstart Affiliated Programs
  • Strategic Investments - Please contact courtney@econ.ucsb.edu with the UCSB Department of Economics for more information on their scholarships.
  • Technology Management - Please contact Cindy Colmenares at cindy@tmp.ucsb.edu with the UCSB Technology Management Department for more information on TMP scholarships
  • Z-School Programs

When?

Empowerment and Opportunity Fund Professional Scholarships are available every quarter including Summer.

Fall 2023 Quarter Scholarships 

Deadline to apply: September 8, 2023

Response by: September 18, 2023

Only the selected Awardees will be notified. If you do not receive a notification, you were not selected.

Winter 2024 Quarter Scholarships

To be determined

Spring 2024 Quarter Scholarships

To be determined

Summer 2024 Quarter Scholarships

To be determined

I have already paid for my course, can I get a scholarship now?

No. 

How much?

Scholarships will cover 100% of the course cost up to $700. Textbooks and other miscellaneous fees are not covered. They are payable by the student.

How do I apply for this Scholarship?

To apply please fill out this form. Only the selected Awardees will be notified.

My course/program has other forms of scholarship available. Can I apply for Empowerment and Opportunity Fund Professional Scholarships as well?

Scholarships are not cumulative. Only one type of scholarship can be used at a time.

 

We may change any of these terms as needed.

Title: VMock: What is my Resume Benchmark and how do I choose (or update) it?
Body:
VMock: What is my Resume Benchmark and how do I choose (or update) it?

Upon logging into VMock the first time, you are presented with a question to choose a Resume Benchmark, which will score your resume with students who have similar career interests. You can update your choice up to six (6) times by clicking on the top navigation bar, choosing Settings, and editing your Student Information. Here is a list of each Resume Benchmark with complete details:

 

  • Getting Started 
     Recommended for career exploration and miscellaneous job opportunities
      
  • Business + Entrepreneurship 
     Recommended for finance, accounting, management, sales, operations, logistics, actuarial science, quantitative analysis, and more
      
  • Communications + Arts 
     Recommended for marketing, advertising, public relations, writing, design, media, film, entertainment, sports, museums, and more
      
  • Education + Human Services 
     Recommended for teaching, child development, counseling, psychology, social services, human resources, nonprofits, and more
      
  • Engineering + Technology 
     Recommended for chemical, mechanical, electrical, and computer engineering, computer science, engineering for non-engineers, and more
      
  • Law + Government 
     Recommended for legal practice and assistance, all forms of government work at the federal, state, and local levels, and more
      
  • Science + Health 
     Recommended for life and physical sciences, health professions, biotechnology, environmental studies, geography, and more
      
  • Resume 
     Recommended for non-academic opportunities
      
  • CV (Graduate Students)

Title: Accreditation
Body:
Accreditation

More information about UCSB's current accreditation is available on the Office of the Executive Vice Chancellor's page.

Title: How long does it take to complete a Professional Certificate Program?
Body:
How long does it take to complete a Professional Certificate Program?

Most students take one to three years to complete a certificate program, depending on the program course requirements. You may proceed at your own pace, but you must complete all course requirements within five years from the date your first course ends.

Title: Asynchronous Online Format
Body:
Asynchronous Online Format

  • All courses in the program are offered in an interactive online format.
  • Course materials are posted on Canvas, UCSB's online learning management system. All assignments and interactions with the instructor will occur through this online system.
  • Within a few hours after enrolling in a PaCE course but no sooner than 60 days before the beginning of the course, you will receive an email from our online learning platform, UCSB Canvas, with instructions on how to complete your Canvas registration and access your online course. You don&'t need to take any action until you receive that email.
  • The course Syllabus will be posted approximately 2 weeks before the first day of class. The remaining course material will be available to students starting on the first day of class.
  • Courses are 10 weeks long, plus finals week, with a scheduled start date and an end date. During this time you will engage online with lectures, videos, readings, and with each other through an online discussion forum. There is no specific time that you need to be online. Instead, you will complete assignments at your convenience, but by a specific due date. Anticipate to spend between 3-5 hours per week.

Title: Marketing Cert - FAQs and Responses
Body:
Marketing Cert - FAQs and Responses

I'm a marketing professional; can my work experience count towards a class or two?

Course requirements are defined on the Marketing Certificate matrix schedule. It is possible to have your work experience count towards hours for the Marketing Internship Course, but as indicated on the website: While it is possible for students to complete an internship with their present employer, internship duties must be substantially different from the student's paid duties.

When is the Internship offered & how soon can I get into this course?

The Marketing Internship Course can be scheduled during any quarter. To be eligible for enrollment in the course you must secure your own internship of at least 90 hours in the area of marketing.

Will all your courses for marketing be available as online courses?

We are working towards incorporating more online classes in the near future.

Can International students participate in this program also?

Yes, the Marketing Certificate program is offered to both local community members and international students. After acceptance to our University Immersion Program you may enroll in individual extension courses. Please visit our Help Center for more information on how to apply to our International Student Programs.

Do you offer marketing degrees through the University?

No. UCSB Extension does not confer degrees. We offer Professional Certificates Programs.

Title: Child Life for International Students: Options for Enrollment
Body:
Child Life for International Students: Options for Enrollment

The Child Life Certificate Program with UCSB Professional and Continuing Education are offered fully online. Courses can be taken from your home country. Please see the option below:

Enrolling in Child Life and Child Life course from home county
Study with us from afar! Child Life and ABA courses are offered fully online, so you can participate like any other student from around the world. Courses will use the UCSB online learning platform, Guachospace, to structure the curriculum and allow for posting of assignments, discussion forums and exams. When you finish the certificate, we will mail it to you!

Course fees are the same as any domestic/community pricing.

Title: Professional Certificate Programs
Body:
Professional Certificate Programs

A A

A Professional Certificate Program is defined as an integrated curriculum of credit courses that totals a minimum of 120 hours of instruction.

Completing a Professional Certificate Program:

  • Represents a major personal achievement!
  • Indicates to employers a serious commitment to lifelong learning and professional advancement. 
  • Provides in-depth academic study of a professional field.
  • Prepares individuals to enter a new career or advance within their current profession.
  • Addresses a full range of subjects within a discipline.
  • Allows students to develop a fundamental knowledge of the field as well as study specialized individual topics.

Courses are graded, and require exams or final projects and out-of-class assignments. Most courses qualify for employer-paid assistance or tuition reimbursement. Professional Certificate Programs generally take from one to three years to complete. Formal application and acceptance to the program is required.

Title: What kinds of professional documents can I upload to VMock?
Body:
What kinds of professional documents can I upload to VMock?

Currently, you can upload any resume in chronological format to VMock. Because VMock operates similarly to most Applicant Tracking Systems, these are the main documents that VMock is able to process.
